title: Manifesto Foundations Quiz
description: Test your understanding of the core concepts from the Elohim Protocol Manifesto

question.content:
According to the Elohim Protocol manifesto, what is the fundamental operating principle around which digital infrastructure should be organized?

[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.content: Efficiency and profit maximization
Love as committed action toward flourishing
Centralized control for security
Engagement optimization

hints.content: The manifesto proposes a radical reimagining of digital infrastructure...
Think about what 'agape' means in the context of the protocol.

question.content:
The manifesto identifies several problems with current currencies. Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a problem with modern currencies?

[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.content: They carry no values
They have no natural limits
They are too difficult to transfer digitally
They fail to reward care work

hints.content: Review the 'Economic Architecture: The Poverty of Currency' section.
The manifesto focuses on values, limits, care, and concentration - not transaction ease.

question.content:
The Elohim Protocol uses a layered constitutional architecture. Which layer is described as 'most immutable' and requires Elohim consensus across all scales?

[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.content: Individual Layer
Community Layer
Nation-State Layer
Global Layer

hints.content: The layers range from most to least immutable...
Universal principles like 'No extinction, no genocide, no slavery' are at this layer.

question.content:
What makes the Elohim security model different from traditional security approaches? Select the answer that best describes the 'Redemptive Security' concept.

[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.content: It blocks and excludes attackers more quickly
It uses stronger encryption to prevent attacks
It transforms adversaries into allies by addressing root causes
It relies on centralized monitoring for faster response

hints.content: Traditional security: ATTACK -> BLOCK -> EXCLUDE -> ESCALATE
Elohim security follows a different pattern: ATTACK -> UNDERSTAND -> HEAL -> ?

question.content:
The manifesto concludes with a radical proposition about love. What does it propose about love and technology?

[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.content: Love is too abstract to be encoded in technology
Love as committed action toward flourishing can be encoded into technological systems
Technology should avoid matters of love and focus on efficiency
Love and technology are fundamentally incompatible

hints.content: The conclusion is titled 'Love as Technology'
It distinguishes between love as sentiment vs love as committed action.
